title: No Publisher for Left Camera Image

content.raw:
Iv noticed now and then that the Left Image publisher goes missing. But the right image publisher does work, probably because I don't subscribe for it. It is detectable if it happens before we start any Task. But would penalize us if it happens in middle of a task.
 Would restarting our client SW a few times, cause gazebo/ros publishers to crash?
 Is there any way to restart Left Image Publisher without restarting gazebo?

 Here is output from the rostopic info commands (this particular case happened at start of task1 before any walking)

$ rostopic info /multisense/camera/left/image_raw
Type: sensor_msgs/Image

***Publishers: None***

Subscribers: 
 * /multisense/camera/stereo_proc (http://127.0.0.1:41597/)

$ rostopic info /multisense/camera/right/image_raw
Type: sensor_msgs/Image

***Publishers: 
 * /gazebo (http://127.0.0.1:42879/*)**

Subscribers: 
 * /multisense/camera/stereo_proc (http://127.0.0.1:41597/)
content.html:
Iv noticed now and then that the Left Image publisher goes missing. But the right image publisher does work, probably because I don't subscribe for it. It is detectable if it happens before we start any Task. But would penalize us if it happens in middle of a task. Would restarting our client SW a few times, cause gazebo/ros publishers to crash? Is there any way to restart Left Image Publisher without restarting gazebo?

Here is output from the rostopic info commands (this particular case happened at start of task1 before any walking)

$ rostopic info /multisense/camera/left/image_raw Type: sensor_msgs/Image

Publishers: None

Subscribers: * /multisense/camera/stereo_proc (http://127.0.0.1:41597/)

$ rostopic info /multisense/camera/right/image_raw Type: sensor_msgs/Image

Publishers: * /gazebo (http://127.0.0.1:42879/)

Subscribers: * /multisense/camera/stereo_proc (http://127.0.0.1:41597/)
